We also analyzed differences in suitability values as a proxy to species' abundance [ 34, 35]. Based on the assumption that population dynamics are in equilibrium with the environment, high suitability indicates areas that best correspond to species' ecological niche. Therefore, areas of high environmental suitability are expected to be areas of high abundance as well [ 34]. Suitability ranges from zero (low suitability) to one (high suitability), thus very low suitability values (e.g. 0.03) are considered as background noise. We reduced background noise from cells with low suitability by removing cells with suitability below the established threshold in either present-day or LGM predictions. This method reduces commission errors, because it removes unsuitable habitat from the range maps. Suitable cells in either time period were maintained in all periods to better assess differences between the two scenarios. We computed the mean suitability in the present (S PRE) and LGM (S LGM) by summing all suitable cell values and dividing the total by the number of cells of occurrence for each species.
